intro: Oxytropis latialata, commonly known as the plains oxytropis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Oxytropis latialata is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
